nodes.text: Janu Godalhi was a human male who lived during the Clone Wars, a conflict that pitted the Galactic Republic against the Separatist Alliance. Shortly after the Battle of Coruscant, Godalhi attended the Mon Calamari ballet Squid Lake, which was performed at the Galaxies Opera House on the planet Coruscant. He wore a green cloak with a hoopskirt hem.

The character of Janu Godalhi first appeared in George Lucas' Revenge of the Sith, wherein Lucasfilm Story Group's Pablo Hidalgo portrayed a background character named Janu Godalhi for Hidalgo's father, Juan.
Despite the fact that his character is fleetingly visible, Hidalgo had to wear contact lenses for the role, due to the fact that Lucas did not want eyeglasses in his film.
